description.undefined:
OWL Classes

There are currently eight classes in the ontology, each of which represents an entry in the DRS as well a two object properties to link sensors and platforms.
OWL Classes

Concept Schemes

The named individuals of each class are also represented as concepts in SKOS concept schemes: data type, ecv, frequency, institutes, platforms, processing levels, products, and sensors. The use of a concept scheme allows easy navigation up and down the tree as well as providing relationships to concepts from other DRS. As well as relationships between sensors and platforms, each ECV concept is related to one or more data type concepts.

SKOS Navigation Down the Concept Scheme
SKOS Navigation Up the Concept Scheme

Collections

The named individuals of each class are also represented as members in SKOS collections: data type, ecv, frequency, institutes, platforms, processing levels, products, and sensors. As well as relationships between sensors and platforms, each ECV concept is related to one or more data type concepts.

SKOS Collections

description.undefined: The different processing levels of satellite observational data that are used within the ESA Climate Change Initiative (CCI).

definition.value: Unprocessed instrument and payload data at full resolution. CCI does not make recommendations regarding formats or content for data at this processing level.

scopeNote.value: Unprocessed instrument and payload data at full resolution. CCI does not make recommendations regarding formats or content for data at this processing level.

definition.value: Geophysical variables derived from Level 1 source data at the same resolution and location as the level 1 data, typically in a satellite projection with geographic information. These data form the fundamental basis for higher level CCI products.

scopeNote.value: Geophysical variables derived from Level 1 source data at the same resolution and location as the level 1 data, typically in a satellite projection with geographic information. These data form the fundamental basis for higher level CCI products.

definition.value: Retrieved environmental variables at the same resolution and location as the level 1 source

scopeNote.value: Retrieved environmental variables at the same resolution and location as the level 1 source

definition.value: Super-collated (L3S): observations combined from multiple instruments into a space-time grid.

scopeNote.value: Super-collated (L3S): observations combined from multiple instruments into a space-time grid.

definition.value: Uncollated (L3U): L2 data granules remapped to a space grid without combining any observations from overlapping orbits.

scopeNote.value: Uncollated (L3U): L2 data granules remapped to a space grid without combining any observations from overlapping orbits.

definition.value: Data sets created from the analysis of lower level data that result in gridded, gap-free products.

scopeNote.value: Data sets created from the analysis of lower level data that result in gridded, gap-free products.

definition.value: Level 2 variables mapped on a defined grid with reduced requirements for ancillary data. Three types of L3 products are defined.

scopeNote.value: Level 2 variables mapped on a defined grid with reduced requirements for ancillary data. Three types of L3 products are defined.

definition.value: Reconstructed unprocessed instrument data at full resolution, time referenced, and annotated with ancillary information, including radiometric and geometric calibration coefficients and georeferencing parameters, computed and appended, but not applied, to L0 data.

scopeNote.value: Reconstructed unprocessed instrument data at full resolution, time referenced, and annotated with ancillary information, including radiometric and geometric calibration coefficients and georeferencing parameters, computed and appended, but not applied, to L0 data.

definition.value: Collated (L3C): Observations combined from a single instrument into a space-time grid.

scopeNote.value: Collated (L3C): Observations combined from a single instrument into a space-time grid.

definition.value: Level 1A data that have been processed to sensor units.

scopeNote.value: Level 1A data that have been processed to sensor units.

definition.value: Level 1b data that have been further processed, e.g. by correcting radiances or by mapping onto a spatial grid, prior to deriving geophysical variables from the data.

scopeNote.value: Level 1b data that have been further processed, e.g. by correcting radiances or by mapping onto a spatial grid, prior to deriving geophysical variables from the data.
